bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to William B. Bean, June 3, 1952

div1.p: Hench suggests that Bean send copies of his talk about Reed to various interested persons.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to William B. Bean, June 3, 1952
div1.opener:
June 3, 1952
Dr. William B. Bean
State University of Iowa
University Hospitals
Department of Internal Medicine
Iowa City, Iowa
My dear Bill:
div1.p:
Yes, our letters did cross in the mail and since you have not sent re-
prints to the close relatives of the Reed family and the Lazear family,
I think it would be much nicer if you did that. May I ask you to send
reprints to the people whose names are below and if you have enough
left, if you will send me six or eight copies, I should like to send them
to some others.

General Walter Lawrence Reed, 2810 Thirty-Sixth Place N.W.
Washington, D. C.
You might send two or three as they have some grandchildren who might like
a copy.

list.item: Mrs. Blossom Reed, Blue Ridge Summit, Pennsylvania
Mrs. John Moran, Calle 25, #804, entre B y C, Apt. 3, Vedado, Havana, Cuba.
P. S. Shoughnessy, Calle 14 No. 31, Miramar, Havana, Cuba
Mr. William Houston Lazear, P.O. Box 812, Santa Barbara, California.
Mrs. W. D. Briggs, 106 The Uplands, Berkeley, Calif. (Lazear's daughter).
General Albert E. Truby, 145 Laurel Street, San Francisco, Calif.
Mrs. J. R. Kean, 2804 N Street N.W., Georgetown, Washington D.C.

div1.p: Let me say again that I think it was a wonderful talk.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
